abstracts.cdata!:
Project ratings are as follows: Project
            outcome is satisfactory; sustainability is likely;
            institutional development impact is substantial; World Bank
            performance is satisfactory; and Borrower performance is
            satisfactory. Some lessons distilled from the project
            include the following: Formulating a realistic timeframe to
            implement the project; avoiding privatization components in
            adjustment operations unless there is a parallel technical
            assistance or investment operation that can provide the
            resources and expertise needed.; providing for supervision
            capacity in the field; and concisely articulating expected
            outcomes and allowing flexibility and adaptability in
            executing adjustment operations. Sector lessons pertained to
            market conditions, the timelines of investments, alternative
            privatizations actions, using sector specialists, concurrent
            IDA-funded projects, forestry reform, the need for
            stakeholders to clearly understand issues and options, and
            the creation of appropriate regulatory, institutional, and
            legal frameworks.
